name: Novotel Sydney Olympic Park

reviews.text: We recently returned from an overnight stay at Novotel Olympic Park. We were going to see an AFL game at ANZ stadium which was right across the road, very convenient, perfect location.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Family Friendly

reviews.text: Check in was good, they were quite busy but the girls on the front desk were very friendly and obliging we even got a free upgrade to an executive spa suite.
reviews.title: Very Ordinary

likes.liked: — Complimentary entry to Aquatic Centre, proximity to Stadium
likes.disliked: — Small rooms, small balcony, lumpy beds, no cable TV channel for kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite itself was good but is starting to show it age, I feel this property is ready for refurbishment. Surface wise the room was clean however beyond that there were very dirty finger marks on light switches, doors and marks down walls. The bathroom decor was dated and tired looking, the large soap pumps attached to the walls were a bit daggy. However the spa bath itself was massive and worked a treat after an afternoon of walking around Olympic Park with our scootering children.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

reviews.text: The bed was great, King sized and soooo soft and comfy, my husband and I slept very well, however, the pillows were bad! Old and lumpy. I was so glad we bought our own pillows with us.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast the next morning was outstanding, a massive variety, well cooked and well stocked. Overall we had a great night away, we were happy with the hotel but just feel that it needs a bit of a face lift. With a refurbishment this property would be amazing. If you have children you must go to Wentworth Common in the park, a great play area for children, sandpits, climbing webs, flying fox and a great cycle track. Our kids had a ball!
reviews.title: One of Accor's better efforts
Terrific
reviews.text: I must admit we were very sceptical after reading the other reviews on the Novotel at Olympic Park. Having been here during the Olympics as a volunteer, we thought we would give it a go. To our relief we found the hotel and most of all the staff utterly wonderful. The park has developed greatly over the years with lots of food offerings available, always something happening in the Park (we went to the baby expo with our daughter). Transport has improved, and the whole park looks like a veritable entertainment area. Much to my husband's pleasure we went to DFO after the baby expo, while he stayed in the hotel to have a beer and read the newspaper in the bar area overlooking Telstra Olympic Stadium. The hotel was clean, fresh and happy, though it should start looking at updating its furniture (though most hotels need to come to think of it). A gold star to all the staff who were most obliging, friendly, had time to spend wth you even when there was lots to do and did not mind having a chat with an old bird!

Good Hotel
reviews.text: At check-in, even with a growing number of people waiting, no additional check-in counters were opened (and there were about 5 counters unattended). Some visitors who cut the queue were not told to wait their turn and instead were served.

description: Novotel Sydney Olympic Park is located 14km from the Sydney CBD, 6km from Parramatta CBD and 21km from Sydney Airport. The hotel is surrounded by 640 hectares of parklands with over 30km of pathways to explore on foot or by hiring a bicycle. Leisure activities available within Sydney Olympic Park include the 4 Aquatic Centre pools, stadium tour, archery, trapeze school, golf driving range, tennis, factory outlet shopping and much more.
